quoteFirst: , calculations are made of the distance a pigeon can be sent. In summer, when daylight begins at half-past three in the morning and lasts till
quoteLast: at night, a trained pigeon can fly about one thousand kilometres in a day, while on a foggy November day, when the daylight begins late and darkness comes on early, the same bird cannot accomplish more than four hundred kilometres.
